problem_text:
Let G be a pro-p group, p > 2, and φ an automorphism of G of order 2. Suppose that the centralizer C_G(φ) is abelian. Is it true that G satisfies a pro-p identity?
An affirmative answer would generalize a result of A. N. Zubkov (Siberian Math. J., 28, no. 5 (1987), 742–747) saying that non-abelian free pro-p groups cannot be represented by 2 × 2 matrices.
A. Jaikin-Zapirain
